DataElement.preferredName: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index Q6 Past Month Overall Sleep Quality Rating Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated perception in the past month rating their overall sleep quality, using a 4 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index Past Month Overall Sleep Quality Rating Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval._Before the present time._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._A question about how an individual would rate their overall sleep quality._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval.

Concepts.definition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval.

Property.preferredName: Past Month Overall Sleep Quality Rating Score
Property.preferredDefinition: Before the present time.:One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:A question about how an individual would rate their overall sleep quality.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
A question about how an individual would rate their overall sleep quality.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: PSQI Quality Score 4 Point Likert Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard for the subjective scoring of sleep quality that ranges from 0: Very good to 3: Very bad.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that something has a high degree of quality, value or worth.

Concepts.definition: An indication that something has a high degree of quality, value or worth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that something has a moderate degree of quality, value or worth.

Concepts.definition: An indication that something has a moderate degree of quality, value or worth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that something has little quality, value or worth.

Concepts.definition: An indication that something has little quality, value or worth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that something has very little quality, value or worth.

Concepts.definition: An indication that something has very little quality, value or worth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring and Interpretation Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are available on the University of Pittsburg, Sleep Medicine Institute website.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.description: During the past month, how would you rate your sleep quality overall?
